meanings.definition: A state of being abandoned or deserted.
meanings.sent1: The lornness of the old, empty house was palpable.
meanings.sent2: She felt a deep sense of lornness when her friends moved away.
meanings.sent3: The lornness of the forgotten teddy bear in the attic made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The lornness of the shipwreck on the shore was a haunting sight.
meanings.sent5: The lornness of the lost puppy's eyes tugged at her heartstrings.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being lonely or forsaken.
meanings.sent1: His eyes reflected a profound lornness as he sat by himself at lunch.
meanings.sent2: The lornness she experienced after the breakup was overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: The lornness of the abandoned amusement park was oddly amusing.
meanings.sent4: The lornness of the empty playground echoed with her solitude.
meanings.sent5: The lornness of the lone tree in the field was a poignant sight.
